japanese: ……さん！　……すぎさーん！
translation: ...San! ...Sugi-saan!
(Yotsu...ba?)
YOTSUBA%p-2;――%p;?!

japanese: ふひゃ！？
translation: HYAA?!

japanese:
あがっ！
あいたっ……たた……。
translation:
AGGH!
Owww... Ouch...

japanese: いたたた……。
translation: Owowow...

japanese:
上杉さーん、急に起き上がらないでくださいよぉ。
頭ぶつかっちゃいました……。
translation:
Uesugi-saaan,
please don't suddenly sit up like that, okay?
I bumped my head...

japanese:
あ、ああ、悪い……。
しかし、痛いってことは夢じゃないんだな。
translation:
Y-yeah, sorry...
But if it hurts, that means it wasn't a dream.

japanese: ……ほっぺたもつねりましょうか？
translation: ...Shall I pinch your cheek?

japanese:
いや、つねらなくてもいい。
もう充分、目は覚めた。
translation:
No, that's quite okay.
I'm fully awake now.

japanese:
それにしても……四葉、お前が無事で
本当によかったよ。
translation:
Anyway...
Yotsuba, I'm really glad you're okay.

japanese:
上杉さんも無事でよかったです。
もし目を覚まさなかったら、どうしようかと……。
translation:
I'm also glad that you're okay too, Uesugi-san.
I was really worried
about what would happen if you didn't wake up...

japanese: 俺、気絶してたのか。
translation: Was I unconscious?

japanese:
はい。
と言っても、私もついさっき
目が覚めたところなんですが……。
translation:
Yeah.
Well, I say that but I woke up just before you...

japanese:
気がついたらここに倒れていて、
すぐ横に上杉さんもいたんです。
translation:
When I came to, I was collapsed here, and
you were right next to me.

japanese:
（運良く、海浜流に運ばれたのか？
　なんにせよ危ないところだった……）
translation:
(Were we lucky and got carried in by the ocean current?
 In any case, that was a close call...)

japanese:
声をかけても全然起きてくれないので、
すっごく心配したんですよ？
translation:
I was really worried because you didn't wake up,
even when I called out to you.

japanese:
（体に痛むところはない。
　海水も飲まずにすんだみたいだし……
　体調も大丈夫そうだな）
translation:
(I don't feel any pain in my body.
 It seems like I didn't swallow any seawater...
 And my condition seems to be okay.)

japanese: 聞いてますか？　上杉さーん？
translation: Are you listening? Uesugi-saaan?

japanese:
四葉、お前は怪我してないか？
気分が悪かったり、どこか痛いところは？
translation:
Yotsuba, are you injured?
Are you feeling sick or does anywhere hurt?

japanese:
はい、大丈夫です。
上杉さんに頭突きされたとこが
少し痛いくらいですね。
translation:
No, I'm fine.
It hurts a little where you headbutted me though.

japanese:
はは、そうか。
とりあえずは一安心だな。
translation:
Haha, that so?
Anyway, that's a relief.

japanese: ところで……ここ、どこでしょう？
translation: By the way...where are we?

japanese:
暗くてよくわからんが、いつも行ってた
別荘近くの浜辺じゃないみたいだな。
translation:
It's too dark to see, but it doesn't seem like
the beach near the villa that we always go to.

japanese:
っていうか！
いつの間にか夜になっちゃってますよね？
まさか、あれから何日もたってるのでは！？
translation:
But like!
It's already become night without us noticing, right?
Could it have been several days since then?!

japanese:
落ち着け、四葉。
何日なんてたってるわけないだろ。
translation:
Calm down, Yotsuba.
There's no way several days have passed.

japanese: で、ですが！
translation: B-but!

japanese:
いいから、ほら。
星を見てみろ。
translation:
It's fine, look.
Look at the stars.

japanese:
ええ！？
お星様にお願いだなんて、
そんなの上杉さんらしくありませんよ？
translation:
Huh?!
Uesugi-san,
it's not like you to make a wish upon a star, you know?

japanese:
そんな非科学的なことに頼るわけないだろ。
この前、星の観察をしたのを忘れたのか？
translation:
I wouldn't rely on such unscientific things.
Didn't I teach you about star observation the other day?

japanese: えっ？　ええっと……。
translation: Huh? Ummm...

japanese:
ちゃんと教えただろ？
ほら、あそこに見えてるのが北極星だ。
translation:
I taught you properly, didn't I?
Look, that one over there is the North Star.

japanese:
北極星！
はい、覚えてます！
translation:
The North Star!
That's right, I remember!

japanese:
北極星が、こないだ観測したときよりも
だいぶ東の位置にある。
translation:
The North Star is quite a bit east
of where we observed it the other day.

japanese:
つまり、日が沈んでから
それほど時間が経過していないってことだ。
translation:
In other words, not much time has passed
since the sun set.

japanese: ……そうなんですか？
translation: ...Is that so?

japanese:
あのな、地球は自転してるんだぞ？
太陽と同じように星だって動いて見えるんだよ。
東から登ってくるんだ。
translation:
You see, the Earth rotates, yeah?
Stars also appear to move like the sun.
They rise from the east.

japanese:
となると、日没前に船から投げ出されちまってから、
あまり時間は経ってないわけだ。
translation:
So, not much time has passed since
we were thrown off the boat, before the sunset,
to now.

japanese:
つまり、そんなに長い時間
流されてたわけじゃないってことに？
translation:
So, in other words,
we didn't drift for too long, right?

japanese: そういうことだな。
translation: Yes, that's right.

japanese:
別荘のある島の周りに、他の島はなかったはず。
となると、同じ島にいると考えるのが妥当だ。
translation:
I know there weren't any other islands
around our island with the villa. So, it's reasonable
to assume that we're on the same island.

japanese:
北極星の位置とこの海岸線の向きからして、
おそらく島の裏……北側に流れ着いたんじゃないか？
translation:
Judging from the North Star's position and the
direction of the coastline, we probably washed up
in the back... The north side of the island, I bet?

japanese:
おおお～！
上杉さん、頼もしすぎですっ！
translation:
Ohhhh!
Uesugi-san, you are just so reliable!

japanese:
遠くまで流されなかったのは幸いだったな。
夜が明けてから周りを調べてみよう。
translation:
It's fortunate that we weren't carried too far.
Let's explore our surroundings after daybreak.

japanese: 早く戻らないと、みんなが心配してるだろうし。
translation: We need to hurry back, everyone must be worried.

japanese:
そうですよね。
……すみません。
translation:
That's right.
...I'm sorry.

japanese: なんだ、どうしてお前が謝るんだ。
translation: What, why are you apologizing?

japanese:
私が、船から夕日を見たいだなんて
言い出したせいで、上杉さんを危険な目に
あわせてしまいました。
translation:
It's because I suggested
that I wanted to see the sunset from a boat.
As a result, I put you in danger, Uesugi-san.

japanese:
その上、みんなやらいはちゃんを
心配させることに……。
translation:
Moreover, I made everyone,
as well as Raiha-chan, worried...

japanese:
お前にやりたいことを聞いたのは俺だろ。
それに、俺がもっと注意してれば
こんなことにはならなかったはずだ。
translation:
But it was me who asked you what you wanted to do.
Besides, if I had been more careful,
this wouldn't have happened.

japanese:
ですが、あのとき私が慌てて
立ち上がったりしなければ……。
translation:
But, if I hadn't panicked
and stood up at that moment...

japanese:
あー、そんなことより腹が減ったな！
夕飯を食う前に別荘を出ちまったし――
translation:
Ah, more importantly, I'm hungry!
We left the villa before dinner%p-2;――

japanese:
……ふふ。
上杉さんのお腹、タイミングよすぎですよ。
translation:
...Heheh.
Your stomach is right on time, Uesugi-san.

japanese: 笑うなよ、自然現象だぞ？
translation: Don't laugh, it's only natural, ya know?

japanese:
すみません。
でも、あんまり大きな音だったので……ふふっ！
translation:
Sorry.
But, it was such a loud noise...
Heheh!

japanese:
仕方ないだろ……。
昼飯からあと、何も食ってないんだ。
translation:
It can't be helped...
I haven't eaten anything since lunch.

japanese:
そうですよね。
実は私もお腹が空いてまして……えへへ。
translation:
That's right.
Actually, I'm also super hungry too... Hehehe.

japanese:
とにかく夜が明けたら、何か
食べられるものを探さないと……。
translation:
Anyway, when morning comes,
we need to find something to eat...

japanese:
あっ！　そうだ！
忘れてました！
translation:
Ah! That's right!
I forgot!

japanese:
なんか、すまん。
飯のことを考えたら急に鳴っちまった。
translation:
Sorry about that.
My stomach suddenly growled
because I was thinking about food.

japanese:
気にしないでください。
私もペコペコですから。
translation:
Don't worry about it.
I'm hungry too.

japanese:
だよな。
お互い、昼飯からあとは何も食ってないんだし。
translation:
Yeah.
We haven't eaten anything since lunch.

japanese: こんなときでも、お腹って減るものなんですね。
translation:
Even in times like these,
our stomachs still get hungry, huh?

japanese:
いいことじゃないか。
腹が減るのは元気な証拠だ。
translation:
That's a good thing.
Being hungry is a sign of good health.

japanese:
とにかく夜が明けたら、何か
食べられるものを探さないと……。
translation:
Anyway, when morning comes,
we need to find something to eat...

japanese:
あっ！　そうだ！
忘れてました！
translation:
Ah! That's right!
I forgot!

japanese: お前は空いてないか？
translation: Aren't you hungry?

japanese: 実は……私もペコペコです。
translation: I'm...actually hungry, too.

japanese: 出たのが夕飯前だったし、やっぱり腹も減るよな。
translation:
It was just before dinner when we came out,
so naturally we're hungry now.

japanese: 私のお腹が鳴っても笑っちゃダメですよ？
translation: Even if MY stomach growls, you shouldn't laugh, okay?

japanese: はあ？　俺を笑っておいて虫のいい話だな。
translation:
Huh?
Laughing at me and THEN saying something so selfish?

japanese:
だって、上杉さんは男の人ですからね。
女の子を恥ずかしがらせるなんて男らしくないです。
translation:
But, you're a man, Uesugi-san.
It's not cool for men to embarrass a girl.

japanese:
だから、そういうことに気がついても、
スルーするのが男のマナーってものですよ！
translation:
So, even if they notice something like that,
it's good manners for a man to just ignore it!

japanese: そんなマナーは知らんわ！
translation: I don't know any manners like that!

japanese:
だが、まあ、相手が嫌がることをしないのは
人としての常識だからな。
覚えておいてやろう。
translation:
But well, it's common sense as human beings
not to do things that other people don't like.
Remember that.

japanese:
ふふっ！
上杉さんはそういうとこ、本当に真面目ですよね。
translation:
Heehee!
Uesugi-san, you sure are serious
about that kind of stuff.

japanese:
なんか引っかかるなそれ。
俺は常に真面目に生きてるぞ？
translation:
That rubs me the wrong way.
I always live seriously, ya know?

japanese:
とにかく夜が明けたら、何か
食べられるものを探さないと……。
translation:
Anyway, when morning comes,
we need to find something to eat...

japanese:
あっ！　そうだ！
忘れてました！
translation:
Ah! That's right!
I forgot!

japanese: な、なんだ？
translation: W-what is it?

japanese:
実はですね、
お昼のおにぎりの余りを持ってるんです。
translation:
Well, actually,
I have some leftover rice balls from lunch.

japanese:
ほら、見てください！
しっかりラップで包んでおいたので
形も崩れてません！
translation:
Look!
They're wrapped up nicely,
so the shape hasn't been ruined!

japanese:
おお、でかした！
しかし、なんでおにぎりなんて持ってたんだ？
translation:
Oh, nice job!
But why do you have rice balls with you?

japanese:
夕日を見ながら一緒に食べようかと
こっそりと用意しておいたんです。
はい、お１つどうぞ。
translation:
I secretly prepared them
so we could eat them together
while watching the sunset. Here, have one.

japanese:
サンキュー。
四葉のおかげで、ひとまず空腹はしのげたな。
translation:
Thanks.
Because of you, Yotsuba, my hunger's been
temporarily satisfied.

japanese:
（こいつを食べたら、どこか
　眠れそうなところを探さないとな……。
　ちょうどよい岩陰でもあればいいんだが）
translation:
(Once we eat, we need to find
 somewhere to sleep...
 If there was a rock in the perfect shape.)
